sentences.english: Ming court belied that its greatest challenges and opportunities were at home.
sentences.chinese: 明朝朝廷認識到最大的挑戰和機遇是在國內。

sentences.english: Think of the endless opportunity our connectedness provides.
sentences.chinese: 想想我們當今社會的連通性給我們所帶來的無限機遇。

sentences.english: Shortage is both opportunities and challenges.
sentences.chinese: 而“‘民工荒’既是機遇，也是挑戰。”

sentences.english: Others seek out the unlimited opportunities this type of self-sufficient livelihood can provide.
sentences.chinese: 別人找機遇這種無限自足的生活可以提供。

sentences.english: Cooperation between China and SAARC thus faces a historical opportunity. China is South Asia's biggest neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 中國與南盟合作面臨着歷史性機遇。

sentences.english: And some of those new opportunities are having a detrimental effect on health.
sentences.chinese: 而且有些所謂的”新機遇“對於健康有不好的影響。

sentences.english: And this one scotoma also is a good luck actually.
sentences.chinese: 而這一盲點其實也是一個機遇。

sentences.english: And it means we should seize on opportunities to learn from one another.
sentences.chinese: 而且這意味着我們應該抓住互相學習的機遇。

sentences.english: In these shifting conditions, opportunities to innovate will abound.
sentences.chinese: 在這個轉型時期，充滿了創新的機遇。

sentences.english: The home-buying opportunities mirror a larger trend.
sentences.chinese: 購房機遇反映了一個更大的趨勢。

sentences.english: Today, KDE faces new challenges and opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 今天，KDE面臨新的挑戰和機遇。

sentences.english: Domestically, our country is still in an important period of strategic opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 從國內看，我國仍處在重要戰略機遇期。

sentences.english: Can the Yellow Land leverage its power to open up new opportunities?
sentences.chinese: 黃土地能不能善加利用它的力量創造新機遇？

sentences.english: This gives you the opportunity to correct the particular fault.
sentences.chinese: 因爲，它給你一個機遇來糾正這個特別的毛病。

sentences.english: Both China-UK relationship and China-EU relationship face important opportunities to build on past success for new progress.
sentences.chinese: 中英關係和中歐關係發展面臨繼往開來的重要機遇。

definition: to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
Belt and Road Initiative, Chinese government plan to provide finance and engineering expertise to build infrastructure across Eurasia and northeast Africa, unveiled in 2013
